data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

One must always face forward. If you are facing left again, you take 9 steps left. One has to take 10 steps forward, in order to return to one's original position. One must take 9 steps right to get back in place. One must take 10 steps backward to get back in place. So, the answer is No.

Taking 8 steps backwards, for example, will return to take 8 steps back towards the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you do not reverse the order of steps. If someone was to take one step left, take 1 step right. If people who can reverse the order are to take 4 steps forward, take 4 steps forward. Final answer: no.

A person facing backwards must always face forward. In the first step, if you move the bare foot from the ground into the air, the first item on the left, or foot, then the one standing left.
